translated: The Mansion on the Plane of the Gods🔽The Divine Woman’s Mansion🔽The Chapter about Seats
The Divine Mansions of the Hair-doer
“This mansion is lovely and radiant,
Made of beryl, always well-built,
Surrounded by golden trees,

analyzed: ṭhānam mamam kamma vipāka sambhava  tatra upapannā purimat śarāḥ imā
translated: The place where I was born as a result of my deeds.🔽Here, a hundred thousand divine women,
Born from their own deeds,
Have come to you, one of great fame,
Shining, you stand as a former deity.
Just as the moon shines, surpassing the stars,
The king of the stars, as if surrounded by a multitude of stars;

analyzed: tathā iva tvam at śarāsaṅgaṇam ima
translated: So you, in this multitude of divine women,

original: Daddallamānā yasasā virocasi.🔽Kuto nu āgamma anomadassane,
analyzed: daddallamānā yasasā virocasi  kutas nu āgamma anomadassane
translated: Shining with fame, you shine forth.🔽From where have you come, O you of incomparable beauty,
That you have been reborn in this mansion of mine?
Like the gods of Brahmā, the thirty gods with Indra,
All of us are not satisfied with seeing you.”
“What you ask me, Sakka,

analyzed: kutas cutā tvam idhe āgatā ati
translated: ‘From where have you come here?’
In the east of the Kāsīs, there is a city named Bārāṇasī,
I was a hair-cutter in the past.

analyzed: buddhe ca dhamme ca pasanna mānasā
translated: I had confidence in the Buddha and the Dhamma,

analyzed: saṅghe ca ekanta gatā a sasayā  akhaṇḍa sikkhāpadā āgata phalā
translated: and was devoted to the Sangha without reservation.🔽My training precepts were unbroken, and I had attained the fruits.

“We rejoice in your words, and welcome you.
You shine with the glory of the Dhamma.

analyzed: buddhe ca dhamme ca pasanna mānase
translated: You have confidence in the Buddha and the Dhamma,

analyzed: saṅghe ca eka anta gate a sa saye  akhaṇḍa sikkhāpade āgata phale  sambodhi dhamme niyate anāmaya iti
translated: and are devoted to the Sangha without reservation.🔽Your training precepts are unbroken, and you have attained the fruits.

The Palace of the Hair-cutter is the seventeenth.🔽The summary:
Five seats, three boats,
two lamps, sesame, and a gift;
Two wives, Uttara,
Sīri, and the hair-cutter.
This is the first sub-chapter, on women.
